misery.translation[0].definitions[0].def: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick
misery.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
misery.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: She looked away so that Tom wouldn’t see her misery.
His face was a picture of sheer misery (=great unhappiness, with no other emotion).
The news plunged him into abject misery (=extreme unhappiness).
misery.translation[0].definitions[2].def: someone who is always complaining and never enjoys anything
misery.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: What’s the matter with you, misery guts (=a name for someone like this)?
